page.title: 07THE HARWORTH COLLIERY (1)
page.content: They began to sink the pit in 1917 and by 1923 the two main shafts had reached a good seam of coal.It was a modern pit producing good coal.However problems with strikes meant loss of output often during the 1920's and 30's.In 1936 between September and December over 62 thousand tons were lost.Some miner's carried on working but others went on strike and because of the troubles convoys of police known as chain gangs had to be drafted into the village.Something similar happened again last year in the miners strike of 1984-5.The colliery was privately owned until nationalization in 1947 and after that time the colliery continued to expand right up until 1965.Now in 1985 the colliery is set to expand its production once again.
